code: mod <- run_jags_model(jagsdata = pkg_data, jagsparams = NULL,                        n_iter = 20000, n_burnin = 2000, n_thin = 9)

what: 5. Estimated model parameters for national one-country runs
title: Package data
text: estimated parameters used one-country national model run. median_alpha_region_intercepts regional intercepts used inform country-specific intercept model, precision_alpha_country_intercepts associated variance country-specific intercepts. Bspline_sigma_matrix_median variance-covariance matrix used inform Wishart prior first-order difference spline coefficients.

what: 6. Estimated model parameters for subnational one-country runs
title: Package data
text: estimated parameters used one-country subnational model run. median_alphacms country-specific intercepts used inform subnational province-specific intercepts model, tau_alpha_pms_hat associated variance province-specific intercepts. sigma_delta_hat variance-covariance matrix used inform Wishart prior first-order difference spline coefficients one-country subnational model.

title: Package data
text: two family planning commodity source datasets provided package - one national level observations, national_FPsource_data one subnational level data subnat_FPsource_data. national level data, vignette calculate_FPsource_national_data_from_DHSmicrodata inst/data-raw folder explains national level data calculated using DHS micro-data. similar approach used subnational data using IPUMS data.

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {mcmsupply: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares},   author = {Hannah Comiskey and Niamh Cahill and Leontine Alkema},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://hannahcomiskey.github.io/mcmsupply/}, }

what: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares
title: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares
text: mcmsupply R package enables users estimate public private sector contributions modern contraceptive method market supplies time low- middle-income countries. mcmsupply uses Bayesian hierarchical models, combined cross-method correlations maximise precision model estimates, even data-sparse settings. R package functionality users estimate individual country’s market supply shares run complex multi-country models. data JAGS models available national subnational administration levels. Lastly, functionaluty available users supply custom datsets wish.

title: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares
text: package can installed cloning repository git clone https://github.com/hannahcomiskey/mcmsupply.git running devtools::install() using R command install.packages("mcmsupply") source code vignettes can found /vignettes/paper_vignettes. brief introduction.

title: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares
text: Quantifying public/private sector supply contraceptive methods within countries vital effective sustainable family planning (FP) delivery. many low middle-income countries (LMIC), measuring contraceptive supply source often relies Demographic Health Surveys (DHS). However, many countries carry DHS approximately every 3-5 years recent data beyond 2015/16. objective estimating set related contraceptive supply-share outcomes (proportion modern contraceptive methods supplied public/private sectors) take advantage latent attributes present dataset produce annual, country-specific estimates projections uncertainty. propose Bayesian, hierarchical, penalized-spline model multivariate-normal spline coefficients capture cross-method correlations. approach offers intuitive way share information across countries sub-continents, model changes contraceptive supply share time, account survey observational errors produce probabilistic estimates projections informed past changes contraceptive supply share well correlations rates change across different methods. results provide valuable information evaluating FP program effectiveness. best knowledge, first model kind estimate quantities. Keywords: Bayesian, family planning, splines, correlation, hierarchical, time-series

what: Citation and link to the national contraceptive method supply share model paper
title: Estimating Public and Private Sector Contraceptive Market Supply Shares
text: Comiskey, Hannah, Alkema, Leontine, Cahill, Niamh. “Estimating proportion modern contraceptives supplied public private sectors using Bayesian hierarchical penalized spline model.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2212.03844 (2022). https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.03844

title:
Wrapper function that retrieves the DHS data used for modelling the
proportion of modern contraceptives supplied by the public and private
sectors at the national and subnational administration levels. — get_data
code: get_data(   national = TRUE,   local = FALSE,   mycountry = NULL,   fp2030 = TRUE,   surveydata_filepath = NULL,   trunc = FALSE )

title:
Wrapper function that retrieves the DHS data used for modelling the
proportion of modern contraceptives supplied by the public and private
sectors at the national and subnational administration levels. — get_data
text: national TRUE/FALSE. Default TRUE national administration level data. FALSE retrieves subnational level data. local TRUE/FALSE. Default FALSE global runs. Decides single-country global run. mycountry name country interest. Default NULL. names potential countries, review vigentte. fp2030 Default TRUE. Filter raw data include Family Planning 2030 focus countries discussed Comiskey et al. paper. surveydata_filepath Path survey data. Default NULL. Survey data .xlsx following format national_FPsource_data. trunc Default FALSE. argument indicates function use small 4 country dataset illustration purposes. See ?mcmsupply::trunc_subnat_FPsource_data ??mcmsupply::trunc_national_FPsource_data details.

title:
Wrapper function that retrieves the DHS data used for modelling the
proportion of modern contraceptives supplied by the public and private
sectors at the national and subnational administration levels. — get_data
text: returns list containing DHS data set used inputs model arguments specify data set .

title:
Wrapper function that retrieves the DHS data used for modelling the
proportion of modern contraceptives supplied by the public and private
sectors at the national and subnational administration levels. — get_data
code: if (FALSE) { raw_data <- get_data(local=TRUE, mycountry="Nepal") raw_data <- get_data(local=FALSE) raw_data <- get_data(national=FALSE, local=TRUE, mycountry="Nepal") raw_data <- get_data(national=FALSE, local=FALSE) }

title: Get JAGS model inputs — get_subnational_modelinputs
text: list modelling inputs JAGS model. Tstar year index recent survey province. Kstar knot index aligns Tstar. B.ik basis functions. n_years total number years n_obs  total number observations K number knots. H K-1. Used calculation first order differences spline coefficients. P_count number subnational provinces/regions. M_count number modern contraceptive methods. matchsubnat subnational province indexing match observed data predictions. matchcountry country indexing match observed data predictions. matchmethod method indexing match observed data predictions. matchyears year indexing match observed data predictions.

title: Get JAGS model inputs — get_subnational_modelinputs
code: if (FALSE) { raw_data <- get_data(national=FALSE, local=TRUE, mycountry="Nepal") jagsdata <- get_modelinputs(startyear=1990, endyear=2030.5, nsegments=12, raw_data) }

what: mcmsupply: Estimating the Proportion of Modern Contraceptive Methods Supplied by the Public & Private Sectors using a Bayesian Hierarchical Penalized Spline Model — mcmsupply-package
title: mcmsupply: Estimating the Proportion of Modern Contraceptive Methods Supplied by the Public & Private Sectors using a Bayesian Hierarchical Penalized Spline Model — mcmsupply-package
text: Family Planning programs initiatives typically use nationally representative surveys estimate key indicators country’s family planning progress. However, recent years, routinely collected family planning services data (Service Statistics) used supplementary data source bridge gaps surveys. use service statistics comes caveat adjustments need made missing private sector contributions contraceptive method supply chain. Evaluating supply source modern contraceptives often relies Demographic Health Surveys (DHS), many countries recent data beyond 2015/16. Fortunately, absence recent surveys can rely statistical model-based estimates projections fill knowledge gap. present Bayesian, hierarchical, penalized-spline model multivariate-normal spline coefficients, account across method correlations, produce country-specific, annual estimates proportion modern contraceptive methods coming public private sectors. package provides quick convenient way users access DHS modern contraceptive supply share data national subnational administration levels, estimate, evaluate plot annual estimates uncertainty sample low- middle-income countries.

title: Wrapper function to run the jags model for estimating the proportion of modern contraceptive methods supplied by the public & private Sectors using a Bayesian hierarchical penalized spline model for the national and subnational administration levels — run_jags_model
text: jagsdata object mcmsupply::get_modelinputs() function. jagsparams parameters JAGS model wish review n_iter Default 80000. Number itterations JAGS model. n_burnin Default 10000. Number samples burn-JAGS model. n_thin Default 35. Number samples thin JAGS model. n_chain Default 2. Number chains run MCMC sample. n_cores number cores use parallel execution subnational estimation. specified, number cores set value options("cores"), specified, approximately half number cores detected parallel package. ... Arguments mcmsupply::get_modelinputs() function.

title: Wrapper function to run the jags model for estimating the proportion of modern contraceptive methods supplied by the public & private Sectors using a Bayesian hierarchical penalized spline model for the national and subnational administration levels — run_jags_model
text: returns jags model object

title: Wrapper function to run the jags model for estimating the proportion of modern contraceptive methods supplied by the public & private Sectors using a Bayesian hierarchical penalized spline model for the national and subnational administration levels — run_jags_model
code: if (FALSE) { raw_data <- get_data(national=FALSE, local=TRUE, mycountry="Nepal") jagsdata <- get_modelinputs(startyear=1990, endyear=2030.5, nsegments=12, raw_data) run_jags_model(jagsdata)  myjagsparams <-c("P","alpha_pms") run_jags_model(jagsdata, jagsparams = myjagsparams) }

what:
The median estimate for the subnational-level variance-covariance matrix of the delta.k terms in the multi-country subnational model.
This array is used to inform the Wishart prior of the single-country subnational model. — sigma_delta_hat

what:
The median estimates of the precision for the subnational-level country, sector-, method-specific intercepts in the multi-country subnational model.
This vector is used to inform the precision in the Normal prior of the subnational-level intercept in single-country subnational models. — tau_alpha_pms_hat
